page.title: 01General Outline
page.content: The block is largely agricultural with the village of Middlezoy the main residential area. Middlezoy is in the County of Somerset and is 14 miles from the County Town of Taunton. Other nearby towns are Bridgwater (6 miles) and Street (8 miles). The name 'Middlezoy' derives from two words, 'Middle' and 'Sowi'. 'Sowi' means island in the marshland. This is a reminder that it is only recently that this part of Somerset has been made passable all the year round. In times past, winter flooding almost cut off this area from the rest of the country. The village is on the only high ground and much of the surrounding countryside is at or even below sea level. This land is drained by means of drainage ditches known as 'rhines' which criss-cross the land and act as boundaries to fields.
